MONL.content: surging wave [déferlment déchainé] of anamnesia that the double interdict unleashed > invent one’s language and “I” at the same time
MONL.linkedContent: surging wave [déferlment déchainé] of anamnesia that the double interdict unleashed > invent one’s language and “I” at the same time

MONL.linkedContent: both at same time: 2 hyperboles, everything can and cannot be translated, “it is easy for me to hold firm between these two hyperboles”

H.content: “at this very moment”: antinomy of laws in the plural and absolutely singular law

H.content: there are 2 plurals, different at same time: 1) multiplicity, plural laws 2) One + a multiplicity, One + n [plus d’un]
H.linkedContent: there are 2 plurals, different at same time: 1) multiplicity, plural laws 2) One + a multiplicity, One + n [plus d’un]

H.content: One + n, the antinomic addition, adds conditional laws to unconditional law of hospitality

H.content: “impossibility of that ‘at the same time’ is at the same time what happens, once and every time, it is what is going to happen, what always happens”
H.linkedContent: “impossibility of that ‘at the same time’ is at the same time what happens, once and every time, it is what is going to happen, what always happens”

LOBL.content: I am “irresponsible” and absolutely committed in the establishment of the language of the other, which I do as if the first moment, the “at once” is the occasion of the hymen, its chance and its law
LOBL.linkedContent: I am “irresponsible” and absolutely committed in the establishment of the language of the other, which I do as if the first moment, the “at once” is the occasion of the hymen, its chance and its law

SPOM.content: ghost is there [re: de-limitation of critique] in the opening of the promise, before its first apparition, from the first it will have come second, deux fois à la fois, itérabilité originaire, virtualité irréductible de cet espace et de ce temps

BL.content: origin of literature at same time as origin of law; story of prohibition (law) is a prohibited story

MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, text defined by considering a statement at the same time performative & constative > this same time never is, will never have been, will never be present

A.content: death, impossible simultaneity (where one and the other arrive together), contretemps
A.linkedContent: death, impossible simultaneity (where one and the other arrive together), contretemps

S.content: origin as hétérogène à l’origine: 1) originarily heterogenous 2) heterogenous to what is called the origin, other than the origin 3) heterogenous and or insofar as at the origin: because and although (bien que) at the same time—is logical form of tension that makes this thought vibrate

SH.content: circumcision only once, at the same time “first & last,” ring, seal of alliance, anniversary of archeology/eschatology > ring traces, carves the “unwiederholbar (unrepeatable)”

CHM.content: praeclare sane, toutefois [beginning of paragraph where Descartes wonders if he’s dreaming]
CHM.linkedContent: praeclare sane, toutefois [beginning of paragraph where Descartes wonders if he’s dreaming]

PP.content: Thoth supplants and supplements (en le suppléant) its other (father, sun, life, speech, origin or orient); at same time Thoth takes shape from very thing it resists and substitutes for
PP.linkedContent: Thoth supplants and supplements (en le suppléant) its other (father, sun, life, speech, origin or orient); at same time Thoth takes shape from very thing it resists and substitutes for

PP.content: Thoth opposes itself, passes into its other > messenger-god is truly god of absolute passage btwn opposites: god of non-identity (if he had identity: coincidentia oppositorum)
PP.linkedContent: Thoth opposes itself, passes into its other > messenger-god is truly god of absolute passage btwn opposites: god of non-identity (if he had identity: coincidentia oppositorum)

PP.content: “at once (à la fois):” identity is doubled as its simulacrum, phantasm, at once (identity of presence, presence of its identity, doubled as soon as it appears)

DS.content: relation of one text to another, open & closed, at the same time > necessary that each organism only refer to itself as determinate
DS.linkedContent: relation of one text to another, open & closed, at the same time > necessary that each organism only refer to itself as determinate

DS.content: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)
DS.linkedContent: “the masculine is turned back on the feminine: whole adventure of sexual difference” > in same blow: fold ruptures virginity it marks as virginity, folding over its secret > nothing more virginal (and at same time) more purloined/penetrated than secret (loses smooth simplicity of its surface)

DS.content: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin
DS.linkedContent: secret differs before letter opener separates lips of the book, divided from/by itself, like hymen > after the fact, it remains what it was, virgin

OS.content: for Aristotle, being-together [of nun and stigmē] not a determination of Being but very production of Being > ama as the pivot (cheville) (clavis), the key opening & closing metaphysics > this complicity so self-effacing as to barely be noticed, the common origin of space & time > Aristotle says w/out saying [Rousseau describing w/out declaring]: the dyad as the minimum
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, being-together [of nun and stigmē] not a determination of Being but very production of Being > ama as the pivot (cheville) (clavis), the key opening & closing metaphysics > this complicity so self-effacing as to barely be noticed, the common origin of space & time > Aristotle says w/out saying [Rousseau describing w/out declaring]: the dyad as the minimum

OS.content: Aristotle’s 1st aporia, nun not part of ousia, because made of now’s (time’s parts), several nows can’t : 1) follow each other by immediately destroying each other 2) not destroy each other immediately 3) or remain in the same now > need temporal intemporal hama to conceive this aporia
OS.linkedContent: Aristotle’s 1st aporia, nun not part of ousia, because made of now’s (time’s parts), several nows can’t : 1) follow each other by immediately destroying each other 2) not destroy each other immediately 3) or remain in the same now > need temporal intemporal hama to conceive this aporia

OS.content: analogy, correspondence: enigma of “at the same time” [re: relation of time to space, changes of place, movement]
OS.linkedContent: analogy, correspondence: enigma of “at the same time” [re: relation of time to space, changes of place, movement]

P.content: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)
P.linkedContent: for Kant, beauty is universality w/out concept—necessitates an analogy, occupation of nonconceptual field by the grid (quadrillage) of conceptual force: sans et avec [concept] en même temps (ama)

ROP.content: deconstruction is archaeological & philolytic, while simultaneously resisting this double motif, radicalizes axiomatics of à la fois
ROP.linkedContent: deconstruction is archaeological & philolytic, while simultaneously resisting this double motif, radicalizes axiomatics of à la fois

ROP.content: for Foucault, psychoanalysis oscillates on both sides of dividing line, in two places, two times, at same time (but he does not think these two times w/ structural possibility of event)
ROP.linkedContent: for Foucault, psychoanalysis oscillates on both sides of dividing line, in two places, two times, at same time (but he does not think these two times w/ structural possibility of event)

ATIA.content: re: following the animal, following the other > hunter/hunted, seducer/seduced, persecutor/fugitive constituted in the same animal in the same instant
ATIA.linkedContent: re: following the animal, following the other > hunter/hunted, seducer/seduced, persecutor/fugitive constituted in the same animal in the same instant

DIF.linkedContent: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice

DST.content: à la fois (double bind) > point out & not point out (relever et ne pas relever)

TR.content: Rousseau’s appeal to others, appeal to future, belongs to same time, same moment, as “myself alone”

LI.content: vices [turns] that interest me: time & place of the other time, the other time in (stead of) the first time, at once

LI.linkedContent: repeatability of both (identificatory) iterability & (altering) iterability > necessity of thinking rule & event, concept & singularity, at once

NOY.linkedContent: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)

ATM.linkedContent: gift of other, debt w/out contract, demands: at the same time, indefinitely equivalent substitution (anonymity) and singularity (rather, absolute uniqueness of proper name)

ATM.linkedContent: Levinas’ 2 instances of “en ce moment même,” le même moment: one belongs to the dialectic, the other has an infinite advance on the 1st, differs/defers it, and yet it is the same

OG.linkedContent: supplement not only procures an absent presence, it distances, masters, protects: supplement transgresses and à la fois respects interdict (acc. play/difference of forces)

EU.content: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities
EU.linkedContent: double keeping of memory & chance (invagination of inside pocket); truth, Wahrheit, what keeps, calls upon [us] to watch faithfully, on coat of arms of American universities
